intro: Gochnatia argyrea, commonly known as silver gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring silver-gray foliage due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Gochnatia argyrea is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
